table-wrap.anchoringText: Values of a = 0.5 and c = 0.08 were selected for the tuning parameters based on the developed recommendations in (Haghighat Sefat et al., 2016b). The objective function was calculated using Eq. 2 with A = 0 (i.e. the mean only) while NPV (Eq. 1) is calculated for the initial 4 years of production period using general economic data for a North Sea development (Table 1).
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Economic parameters for calculating NPV.

td.b: Operating cost of the produced liquid

table-wrap.anchoringText: This illustrates the case when the model-based, proactive optimization scenario is applied to the actual wells, while the actual reservoir is different from that described by the model. Table 2 shows the percent improvement in NPV of each realization and the percent change in the mean and variance of NPV, all calculated w.r.t. the base case (with fully-open ICVs). We observe that single realization optimization, while providing the maximum improvement for that particular realization, fails to provide optimal performance for other realizations.
table-wrap.label: Table 2
table-wrap.caption: Changes in the NPV of each realization, mean and variance w.r.t. the base-case when the control scenario is obtained using single-realization optimization or robust optimization

formatted-caption.caption-text: Changes in the NPV of each realization, mean and variance w.r.t. the base-case when the control scenario is obtained using single-realization optimization or robust optimization
